result.execSummary:
The defendant KYLE W NEWTON was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.

All financials same as noted above. 
Must submit DNA sample.

DE eligible for any programming while in prison.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: letter from defendant
Shawano County DNA Proof of Submission - signed by DE

10:30 AM Defendant KYLE W NEWTON in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Kolell in court for KYLE W NEWTON.  Attorney Laura Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin.  PLQ filed w/ NC plea.  ADA Nelson makes recommendation - $200 fine plus costs, 180 days jail consecutive to any other sentence.  Court reviews rights, charges & penalties w/DE. DE enters NC pleas.  Court accepts waiver, plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty. Sentencing arguments.  Atty Kolell argues for 90day jail.
Court sentences DE: 120 days jail consecutive to any other sentence. $200 fine plus costs and $250 DNA surcharge & sample.   DE eligible for any programming while in the prison system.   Appeal rights given to DE.
Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum
Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum

8:26 AM Attorney Matthew Kolell in court for KYLE W NEWTON.  Attorney Gregory A. Parker in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant recently transferred to Dodge Correctional and arrangements were not made. Atty.. Kolell is still awaiting an offer.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 22, 2022 at 08:15 am.
